article.headline: Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 74, McNeese St. 62
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas (AP) -- Cedric Smith came off the bench to score 14 points in Texas A&M-Corpus Christi's 74-62 win over McNeese State on Saturday. Smith was one of four Islanders to score in the double digits. Josh Washington had 13 points, including three 3-pointers. Scooby Johnson had 12 points and Chris Daniels scored 11. The Islanders (10-4) led 34-31 at the break and extended their lead to 13 with 7:48 remaining. They turned 17 McNeese State turnovers into 24 points. Jarvis Bradley led the Cowboys (5-10) with 18 points and 10 rebounds. John Ford added 13 points, including a pair of 3-pointers, and Troy Aaron had 12 points. McNeese State hit only 32 percent of its second-half shots compared to 68 percent shooting by the Islanders.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
